item.title: Chris add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Chris add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Chris add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Chris add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Though a good deal is too strange to be believed, nothing is too strange to have happened." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Chris add a quote by Philip Barry
item.description: "The time to make up your mind about people, is never." -- Philip Barry

item.title: Chris add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Chris add a quote by Kay Ryan
item.description: "The day misspent, the love misplaced, has inside it the seed of redemption. Nothing is exempt from resurrection." -- Kay Ryan

item.title: Chris add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Watch out for intellect, because it knows so much it knows nothing and leaves you hanging upside down, mouthing knowledge as your heart falls out of your mouth." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Chris add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Chris add a quote by George S. Patton
item.description: "If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking." -- George S. Patton

item.title: Chris add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Chris add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "Remember the quiet wonders. The world has more need of them than it has for warriors." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Chris add a quote by Roald Amundsen
item.description: "Adventure is just bad planning." -- Roald Amundsen

item.title: Chris add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Chris add a quote by Elaine May
item.description: "You know how sometimes you lie in bed at night and think, “What if the law of gravity just wears out and lets go and I drift into space?” Does that ever make you anxious?" -- Elaine May

item.title: Chris add a quote by David Henry Hwang
item.description: "I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy." -- David Henry Hwang

item.title: Chris add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "what matters most is how well you walk through the fire" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Chris add a quote by Michael Palin
item.description: "You can't get a suit of armour and a rubber chicken just like that. You have to plan ahead." -- Michael Palin

item.title: Chris add a quote by Ashleigh Brilliant
item.description: "My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot." -- Ashleigh Brilliant

item.title: Chris add a quote by Mary Higgins Clark
item.description: "Funny, when you finally faced reality, it was amazing how clearly you could see things." -- Mary Higgins Clark

item.title: Chris add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "Reading was my escape and my comfort, my consolation, my stimulant of choice: reading for the pure pleasure of it, for the beautiful stillness that surrounds you when you hear an author's words reverberating in your head." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Chris add a quote by Stewart O'Nan
item.description: "You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved." -- Stewart O'Nan

item.title: Chris add a quote by Sinclair Lewis
item.description: "We'd get sick on too many cookies, but ever so much sicker on no cookies at all." -- Sinclair Lewis

item.title: Chris add a quote by Karen Blixen
item.description: "I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea." -- Karen Blixen

item.title: Chris add a quote by W.G. Sebald
item.description: "It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane." -- W.G. Sebald

item.title: Chris add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When I was a boy of 14, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be 21, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years." -- Mark Twain
